Customer.title: Customer
Customer.description: Represents a customer who needs assistance with tasks.

id.description: Unique identifier for the customer entity.

firstName.description: The first name of the customer.

lastName.description: The last name of the customer.

email.description: The email address of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

Helper.title: Helper
Helper.description: Represents a helper who provides assistance with tasks.

id.description: Unique identifier for the helper entity.

firstName.description: The first name of the helper.

lastName.description: The last name of the helper.

email.description: The email address of the helper.

phone.description: The phone number of the helper.

skills.description: List of skills the helper possesses.

bio.description: A short biography of the helper.

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task posted by a customer.

id.description: Unique identifier for the task entity.

description.description: A detailed description of the task.

category.description: The category of the task (e.g., Cleaning, Laundry).

location.description: The location where the task needs to be performed.

budget.description: The budget allocated for the task.

status.description: The current status of the task (e.g., Open, Assigned, Completed, IN_DISPUTE, REASSIGNED).

assignedHelperId.description: Reference to Helper. (Relationship: Helper 1:N Task). Nullable if task is not assigned.

Offer.title: Offer
Offer.description: Represents an offer submitted by a helper for a task.

id.description: Unique identifier for the offer entity.

price.description: The price offered by the helper.

eta.description: The helper's estimated time of arrival to perform the task.

message.description: A message from the helper to the customer.

Admin.title: Admin
Admin.description: Represents an administrator who manages the platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the admin entity.

firstName.description: The first name of the admin.

lastName.description: The last name of the admin.

email.description: The email address of the admin.

Rating.title: Rating
Rating.description: Represents a rating given by a customer to a helper after task completion.

id.description: Unique identifier for the rating entity.

SupportTicket.title: Support Ticket
SupportTicket.description: Represents a support ticket submitted by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the support ticket.

userId.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user submitting the ticket.

userEmail.description: The email of the user submitting the ticket.

subject.description: The subject of the support ticket.

message.description: The detailed message from the user.

status.description: The current status of the support ticket.

ChatMessage.title: Chat Message
ChatMessage.description: A message within a task negotiation chat.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support the tasKey application, focusing on task management, user roles (Customers, Helpers, Admins), and efficient data access with robust security rules.  The key principle is Authorization Independence, achieved through denormalization. For example, tasks denormalize customerId, and offers denormalize helperId and taskId, allowing rules to validate access without needing to `get()` parent documents. 

*   **Customers:** `/customers/{userId}` stores customer profiles.
*   **Helpers:** `/helpers/{userId}` stores helper profiles.
*   **Tasks:** `/tasks/{taskId}` stores task documents. Tasks denormalize `customerId` to ensure Authorization Independence.
*   **Offers:** `/tasks/{taskId}/offers/{offerId}` is a subcollection within each task. This simplifies security rules as access to offers can be inherited from the parent task.
*   **Ratings:** Ratings are stored in `/ratings/{ratingId}`. They denormalize `taskId`, `customerId`, and `helperId` for authorization independence and simpler querying.
*   **Admins:** Admin status is managed via document existence in `/roles_admin/{userId}`.  This leverages the "existence over content" pattern for global role management.
*   **Task Chats**: A new top-level collection `task_chats` is added to handle the negotiation phase. Each document represents a chat thread, and messages are a subcollection within it. This separates chat data from the main task document for cleaner data management and more specific security rules.


**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**

*   The structure supports secure `list` operations.
*   Helpers can list all documents in the `/tasks` collection, but rules on `get` will prevent them from reading full details of tasks they are not involved in.

This structure adheres to all core design principles and strategy mandates, ensuring a secure, scalable, and debuggable Firestore database for the tasKey application.
